title: [K-12] Constructivist English Collaborative Education Curriculum for Academic Preparation

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level English proficiency and awareness of college academic preparedness requirements
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment for adult ESL learners preparing for U.S. university admission, focusing on academic English proficiency development

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to analyze academic papers and lecture materials to identify and summarize key concepts.

In academic presentations and discussions, learners demonstrate communication skills by using ten or more logical English expressions (comparison, causation, inference, etc.) in a 3-minute presentation or 5+ discussion turns, meeting four or more of five rubric criteria.

Using a peer review system, learners can write three or more academic texts (essays, reports), achieving 3/4 or higher in structural completeness (clarity of introduction-body-conclusion) and linguistic accuracy (fewer than five grammar/vocabulary errors) per text.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
